_header: Saint Dominic the holy friar in Spain was I-bore
Subjects: saints’ lives; Dominic, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Dominic in the South English Legendary — couplets

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint dompinke þe holy frere in spayne was I borein þe
                    toun of cailre wel good was þe more…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…Now bidde we seint domenyk þat þe ordre haþ I
                    brouȝtþat we ben forþ wit him to þe ioye of heuene be
                    tauȝt

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Dominik þe noble frere in Spayne was i boreIn þe
                    toun of Cailre wel good was þe More…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Now bidde we seint Dominik þat þe Ordre haþ i
                    wrouhtÞat we beo forþ wiþ him to þe Ioye of heuene i
                    brouht. AMEN. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint Domenic þe holie frere in spayne was i boreIn þe
                    toune of Saylye wel guod was þe more…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Bidde we ore louerd and ore lauedi for Seint Dominikes
                    loueÞat we moten aftur ore ende day to þe blisse of heuene
                    come
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 278-88.

CULAdd2585c.First Lines:
Seint domnyk þe holy man in spayne was i booreIn þe town
                    of Salche hee cam of noble mooreA knyȝte ffelyce his fader heet his
                    mother heet annejeneIs moder glad was of þe sone [
                    ]…
CULAdd2585c.Last Lines:
…Sone sche seyde pax pes þy meny & þyn oreI wil
                    not seyde oure swete lorde þis synne þus ill more

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint dominike þe holy frere in spayn was y boreIn þe
                    toune of gailie wel goud was þe more…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…bydde we oure lord & oure ledy & seint dominik þe
                    frereþat we moten after oure endyng in heuene ben
                    partynere

BLEge1993.First Lines: SEint Dominic þe holi frere in spaine was iboreIn þe toun of cailre welle god was þe more…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Now biddeþ seint seint dominic þat þe hordre haþ iwrouȝtÞat we beo forþ wiþ him to þe ioie of heuene brouȝt
BLEge1993.Note:
Not included as occurring in this MS in Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943 or Boffey  and  Edwards (2005)
XJulia Boffey,   and  A. S. G. Edwards.  
             A New Index of Middle English Verse.
         London: The British Library, 2005.

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Dominik þe holy frere in Spayne was y boreIn þe
                    toun of Cailye wel gode was þen þe more…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Pray we oure lord & oure lady & saynt Domynik þe
                    frereÞat we mot after oure endinge day in heuen be her fere
                    Amen
Lam223.Note:
At the end of the second line, ‘more’ is glossed: ‘.i.
                    rote’.
